IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THOMAS COLLEGE PREPARES STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS IN THEIR PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL LIVES, AND FOR LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THOMAS PROVIDES A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT VALUES THE NEEDS AND GOALS OF INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS. AT THOMAS, STUDENTS DISCOVER AND FULFILL THEIR UNIQUE POTENTIAL. EACH PROGRAM AT THE COLLEGE PROMOTES PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE, INFORMED BY ETHICS AND INTEGRITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THOMAS COLLEGE PREPARES STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS IN THEIR PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL LIVES, AND FOR LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THOMAS PROVIDES A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT VALUES THE NEEDS AND GOALS OF INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS. AT THOMAS, STUDENTS DISCOVER AND FULFILL THEIR UNIQUE POTENTIAL. EACH PROGRAM AT THE COLLEGE PROMOTES PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE, INFORMED BY ETHICS AND INTEGRITY.
IRS990.Description: Instruction - Undergraduate and graduate education offering associates , bachelor and masters degree programs concentrating in business, education, technology, criminal justice and psychology to approximately 700 full-time students and 300 part-time students

OtherLiabilities.Description: Due to Federal Gov't Perkins loans

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The endowment funds are held in perpetuity with the income being used primarily for the purpose of providing scholarships to students.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THOMAS COLLEGE PUBLICIZES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ON ALL ADMISSIONS APPLICATIONS, COURSE CATALOGS AND ON-LINE ADMISSIONS MATERIAL.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The organization receives funds from various programs of the United States Department of Education, such as the Federal Perkins Loan Program, the Federal Work Study Program, and the Federal Pell Program. These funds allow the College to help students to finance the cost of their education.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THOMAS C0LLEGE PROVIDES POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES USES COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY SURVEY DATA AS WELL AS A REVIEW OF PERFORMANCE WHEN THEY VOTE ON COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT. THE PRESIDENT USES COMPARATIVE DATA AS WELL AS A REVIEW OF PERFORMANCE IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH BOARD OF TRUSTEE MEMBER IS PROVIDED WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. TRUSTEE MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO DISCLOSE ANY INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. SHOULD A MATTER ARISE IN WHICH A TRUSTEE HAS A CONFLICT, HE/SHE WILL RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM VOTING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY OF THE 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD AT THE JANUARY BOARD MEETING BY THE CFO. QUESTIONS ARE ANSWERED BY THE CHAIR, PRESIDENT AND CFO.
